<!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 76664 |area_code = [[Area code 254|254]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 48-46824{{GR|2}} |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 1362206{{GR|3}} |website = |footnotes = }} '''Mart''' is a city in [[Limestone County, Texas|Limestone]] and [[McLennan County, Texas|McLennan]] Counties in the [[U.S. state]] of [[Texas]]. The population was 2,273 at the 2000 census.
The McLennan County portion of Mart is part of the [[Waco, Texas|Waco]] [[Waco metropolitan area|Metropolitan Statistical Area]].
==Geography== Mart is located at {{coord|31|32|34|N|96|49|52|W|city}} (31.542704, -96.831151){{GR|1}}.
According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the city has a total area of 1.3 square miles (3.5 kmÂ²), all of it land.
==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 2,273 people, 832 households, and 550 families residing in the city. The [[population density]] was 1,692.0 people per square mile (654.9/kmÂ²). There were 934 housing units at an average density of 695.2 per square mile (269.1/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the city was 68.28% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 27.54% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.48% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 0.04% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 2.46% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 1.19% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 5.81% of the population.
There were 832 households out of which 29.2% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 45.8% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 17.3% had a female householder with no husband present, and 33.8% were non-families. 31.9% of all households were made up of individuals and 18.5% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.53 and the average family size was 3.21.
In the city the population was spread out with 31.1% under the age of 18, 6.6% from 18 to 24, 22.7% from 25 to 44, 18.7% from 45 to 64, and 20.9% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 36 years. For every 100 females there were 85.4 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 76.3 males.
The median income for a household in the city was $26,603, and the median income for a family was $33,203. Males had a median income of $26,750 versus $19,784 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the city was $12,721. About 15.9% of families and 20.8% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 34.3% of those under age 18 and 7.7% of those age 65 or over.
==Education== The City of Mart is served by the [[Mart Independent School District]].
==Notable residents== * [[Quan Cosby]], former wide receiver for [[The University of Texas]] currently with the [[Cincinnati Bengals]], is a native of Mart. * [[Jesse Plemons]], who plays Landry on [[NBC]]'s "[[Friday Night Lights (TV series)|Friday Night Lights]]", is a native of Mart. * [[Cindy Walker]], the famed country music songwriter of "[[You Don't Know Me (Eddy Arnold song)|You Don't Know Me]]", "[[Sugar Moon]]", and other hits, is a native of Mart.
